intro: Senebiera heleniana, commonly known as the Greek senebiera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Senebiera heleniana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to grow in sunny, well-drained environments.
